basics.name: Mikhail Shkaralevich
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

highlights: Performed 3D scanning using "Leica RTC360", registered scans in "Cyclone 360".
Created various designs in AutoCAD and Civil3D under supervision of licensed engineering professionals.
Reviewed and interpreted engineering blueprints and drawings to determine best approaches to projects.
Obtained knowledge of civil engineering techniques through training opportunities and industry documents publications
Performed construction reporting, file management and documentation.

work.summary: Commercial fishing of red salmon in Dilingham, AK.
highlights: Sold catches directly to local businesses to meet fresh market demands and maintained relationships with buyers and vendors to promote sustainable revenue channels.
Monitored optimal fishing locations to maximize catch results on each trip.
Participated in animal damage control, wildlife management.
Completed minor repairs and general maintenance and shipboard equipment to keep machinery operational (stored netting, cables, lines and ropes correctly to minimize wear and prevent damage).
Monitored fish, checking for defects and disease and promptly discarded deceased fish to prevent illness.
Assembled kitchen cabinets of various types replacing parts to meet regulatory code standards, wrapped them and prepared for shipping.
Worked closely with team members to deliver project requirements, develop solutions and meet deadlines.
Maintained clean, safe working environment by removing waste from job site prior to shift completion.
Read plans, instructions or specifications to determine work activities.
Logged inventory to track supply counts, organize equipment, and gather important materials.

awards.title: W. Wesley and Hiromi Peterson Student Support Endowment
Fred and Annie Chan Scholarship for Information and Computer Sciences
Manoa Next Steps to Future Scholarship
